item.description:
Minna-san,

It's hot out, it's muggy, why stay in the city when you could go enjoy a wonderful day at the park? Well, why don't you join us this upcoming Saturday for a barbecue, fishing, swimming, frisbee, or anything else you would like to do over at Cochituate State Park, just a bit west of Boston.

Swimming
Feel free to bring a bathing suit for swimming, and there are bathrooms at the park as well.

Fishing
If anyone is interested in fishing or learning how to fish, let me know. I will also bring two extra fishing rods, and should have enough gear to keep you happy. I don't have any live bait, so feel free to bring your own if you want. Also, if you don't have a Massachusetts fishing license, you can purchase a 3-day license for $7.50 from this website:
http://www.sport.stat...

Volunteering
We will need everyone to cooperate a bit in getting together food, drinks, and other lunch items. Everyone should bring something to for themselves to eat and/or barbecue, but I also need some volunteers to bring the following items:

Paper Plates: Rob S.
Plastic Fork, Knives: maybe Rob S. (I'll see what I can find)
Charcoal: Brian
Spatula: Brian
Napkins: maybe Rob S.
Skewers: haikuguy
Extra Spatula: Rob S.

Extra Food (to share):
Evan Owens - various munchies
Jim Zhu - Chips
Alisa - food (don't know what :P )
Charlie - sausages
Rob - (if I can get to the supermarket in time) hot dogs and hot dog buns

Extra Drinks (to share):
Jim Zhu - soft drinks
Paul - beverages

I will keep updating this post as I receive volunteers.

Directions to the park:
Cochituate State Park is located in the greater Boston area in eastern Massachusetts.
From East or West: Massachusetts Turnpike (Rte. I-90) to exit 13, Rte. 30 east. Park is on the right.

From Mass Pike: Take the Mass Turnpike (Rt. I-90) to Exit 13 to Rt. 30 East. The park is Â½ mile down on the on the right.

From Route 9: Follow Route 9 East or West to the Speen Street exit in Framingham. Go North on Speen Street. Follow Speen Street for 1 mile until you come to Route 30. Turn right onto Route 30. Park is 200 yards down on the right hand side.

Available Transportation:
If you have a car and are willing to transport people, please let me know by e-mail me through the meetup page or by posting to our message boards. If you need a ride, also please let me know.

Brian will bring a car and has room for 4 people. I will find out where he plans to meet everyone.

I will also take my car, and have room left for 1 person. I live in N. Quincy off of the red line, and can either meet at my home, or over in front of MIT at Mass Ave.

Fees
It costs $5 to park at the Cochituate State Park, so if you are riding in someone's car, please bring a few dollars to help pay for parking and for gasoline. There are also boats to rent at the park that cost about $15 per hour.

As always, look forward to seeing you all there!

Rob

P.S. Everyone be extra nice to Brian for coming up with and organizing this event!
item.how_to_find_us: Park/meet near the kayak rental and boat ramp - I will have my phone with me.
item.name: Barbecue, Fishing, Swimming, Sports, etc. @ Cochituate State Park!
